Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
INVOCATION - Delivered by: Rabbi Yaacov Behrman, Founder the Jewish Future Alliance, Liaison For Chabad Headquarters located at 824 Eastern Parkway, Brooklyn NY 11213.

Motion to spread the Invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Hudson.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by  Rabbi Yaacov Behrman, Founder, The Jewish Future Alliance, Liaison for Chabad Headquarters located at 842 Eastern Parkway, Broooklyn, N.Y. 11213

Council Member Hudson moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Authorizing an increase in the amount to be expended annually in 9 business improvement districts.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing the amount to be expended annually in the Madison Avenue business improvement district and amending the district plan of such district to change the method of assessment upon which the district charge is based
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Madison Avenue BID

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass and the President to sign H.R. 4052, the National Infrastructure Bank Act of 2023.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Finance
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and  Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Majority Leader and  Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following 7 Council Members formally noted their intention to vote negative against this item: 
Council Members Ariola, Carr, Holden, Marmorato, Paladino, Vernikov and the Minority Leader (Council Member Borelli).

The following Council Member formally noted her intention to abstain from voting on this item:  
Council Members Zhuang,

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: National Infrastructure Bank Act of 2023. (H.R. 4052)

Items.Title: Resolution calling on Congress to pass, and the President to sign, a renewed Farm Bill that increases funding for life-saving food aid.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Renewed Farm Bill that increases funding for life-saving food aid.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, S.5964/A.8263, also known as the Empire State Licensing Act, which provides all New Yorkers with access to professional, occupational, commercial, or business licenses, permits, certificates, or related registrations regardless of an applicant's citizenship or immigration status, or lack thereof
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Immigration
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following 8 Council Members formally noted their intention to vote in the negative against this item:  
Council Members Ariola, Carr, Hanks, Holden, Marmorato, Paladino, Vernikov, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Borelli).

The following Council Member formally noted his intention to abstain from voting on this item:  
Council Member Yeger.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Empire State Licensing Act (S.5964/A.8263)

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to introduce and pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation amending the tax law to authorize the City of New York to offer a tax credit for businesses to incentivize the creation of workforce development and training programs for newly arrived immigrants.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Immigration
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following 7 Council Members formally noted their intention to vote in the negative against this item: 
Council Members Ariola, Carr, Holden, Marmorato, Paladino, Vernikov, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Borelli).

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Amending the tax law to authorize the City of New York to offer a tax credit for businesses to incentivize the creation of workforce development and training programs for newly arrived immigrants.

Items.MatterName: Requiring the cleaning of medians at least once per quarter.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to expanding the availability of the newborn home visiting program
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Expanding the availability of the newborn home visiting program.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of social services to provide an application confirmation notice and document receipts for applications for benefits
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of social services to provide an application confirmation notice and document receipts for applications for benefits.

Items.Title: Resolution condemning President-elect Donald Trump for threatening the institutions and norms of democracy.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations, State & Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Condemning President-elect Donald Trump for threatening the institutions and norms of democracy.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to language accessibility at ferry terminals
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
Items.MatterName: Language accessibility at ferry terminals.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing a program that transfers liability for certain engine idling violations to lessees of vehicles
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Environmental Protection, Resiliency and Waterfronts
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection, Resiliency and Waterfronts
Items.MatterName: Establishing a program that transfers liability for certain engine idling violations to lessees of vehicles.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the creation of a comprehensive stormwater plan and a stormwater dashboard, and to repeal section 24-526.1 of such code, relating to the creation of a sustainable stormwater management plan
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Environmental Protection, Resiliency and Waterfronts
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection, Resiliency and Waterfronts
Items.MatterName: Creation of a comprehensive stormwater plan and a stormwater dashboard.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, S.9456, which would make the Council of the City of New York responsible for determining annual rental payments charged to the New York City Water Board.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection, Resiliency and Waterfronts
Items.MatterName: Make the Council of the City of New York responsible for determining annual rental payments charged to the New York City Water Board (S.9456).

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, S.1980/A.3690, S.2059/A.3115, and S.2782/A.3193, which would ensure the wealthiest New Yorkers pay their fair share and increase tax revenues for New York State.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Ensure the wealthiest New Yorkers pay their fair share and increase tax revenues for New York State (S.1980/A.3690, S.2059/A.3115, S.2782/A.3193).

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States House of Representatives to pass, the United States Senate to introduce and pass a companion bill, and the President to sign H.R. 9857, or Mel’s Law, to require higher education institutions to award posthumous degrees to eligible deceased students
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Higher Education
Items.MatterName: Require higher education institutions to award posthumous degrees to eligible deceased students (H.R. 9857).

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting the sale of flavored cigarettes
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting the sale of flavored cigarettes.

Items.MinutesNote: The Majority Leader (Council Member Farías) presiding as the President Pro Tempore.

The presence of a quorum was announced by the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías).

There were 50 Council Members marked present at the Stated Meeting.
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Adams) made the following announcements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Adams), the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) adjourned these proceedings to meet again for the Charter Meeting of Wednesday, January 8, 2025.

MICHAEL M. McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council

Items.MinutesNote: The Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately:

Int. No. 103-A,  VOTE: 35-15-0
Negative: Council Members Aviles, Bottcher, Brewer, Cabán, Hanif, Hudson, Joseph, Marte, Nurse, Ossé, Restler, Rivera, Sanchez, Stevens, and Won. 

Int. No. 104-A,  VOTE: 38-11-1
Negative: Council Members Bottcher, Brewer, Hanif, Hudson, Joseph, Krishnan, Nurse, Ossé, Restler, Stevens, and Won.
Abstentions: Council Member Cabán.

Int. No. 532-A,  VOTE: 44-6-0
Negative: Council Members  Aviles, Cabán, Nurse, Ossé, Stevens, and Won.

Int. No. 1090-A,  VOTE: 49-1-0
Negative: Council Member Yeger.

Int. No. 1098,  VOTE: 49-1-0
Negative: Council Member Yeger.

Int. No. 1111-A,  VOTE: 41-9-0
Negative: Council Members Ariola, Carr, Hanks, Holden, Marmorato, Paladino, Vernikov, Zhuang, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Borelli).

See files for individual votes.

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.
